abstract: In an interview, Bill Gates, chairman of Microsoft, declined to call Google a monopolist, but said powerful forces support its dominance of search. He also criticized Google’s threat to pull out of China over censorship of search results.
snippet: In an interview, Bill Gates, chairman of Microsoft, declined to call Google a monopolist, but said powerful forces support its dominance of search. He also criticized Google’s threat to pull out of China over censorship of search results.
lead_paragraph: Bill Gates dropped by The New York Times on Monday to discuss his full-time job as head of the Gates Foundation, the world’s largest philanthropy, especially its work in global health and development.

headline.main: Bill Gates Defends Google, Then Pans It

abstract: DealBook rounds up the reactions of the wayward press as Davos 2010 begins.
snippet: DealBook rounds up the reactions of the wayward press as Davos 2010 begins.
lead_paragraph: A new raft of uncertainties face the financial industry as its chieftains head to Davos, Switzerland, this year for the annual World Economic Forum. Last year, survival was at the top of the list. But at the 2010 event, a host of proposed regulatory reforms looms large over the banking industry.

headline.main: Davos in the Media: Whither the Forum in 2010?

abstract: Tired of waiting for approval from Apple, Google releases a new browser version of Google Voice for the iPhone.
snippet: Tired of waiting for approval from Apple, Google releases a new browser version of Google Voice for the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: The spat that erupted last summer among Google, Apple and AT&T over Google Voice remains unresolved, which means the app for the popular call routing and calling service from Google is still not available on the iPhone.

headline.main: Google Voice Comes to iPhone, Palm Pre
